conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid flows from A to the left.
Liquid encounters a black baffle that directs it downward.
Liquid flows downward and reaches container D.
Liquid flows from B to the right.
Liquid encounters a purple baffle that directs it downward.
Liquid flows downward and reaches container E.
Liquid flows from C to the right.
Liquid encounters a cyan baffle that directs it downward.
Liquid flows downward and reaches container F.
Liquid from A flows into container D.
Liquid from B flows into container E.
Liquid from C flows into container F.
The liquid will flow into containers D, E, and F from points A, B, and C, respectively.
